poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Everything you apprehend Is a prisoner made to strip And be A given sign In a given cell. Sip and hold In tongue and palate Skip the talk And skimp on thinking Till it sink in. Leafs'll scrimp The rain. They won't let dab, They won't let slip. Till A casual snip or the careful Scrip of drapers shears Cut to fit. Cut you to fit.
